import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from features
if 'Id' in X_train.columns:
    X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
if 'Id' in X_test.columns:
    X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])
if 'Id' in X_val.columns:
    X_val = X_val.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', SimpleImputer(strategy='median'), numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

# Train on training data
X_train_encoded = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_encoded = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val_encoded)
val_r2 = r2_score(validation_df[target], y_val_pred)
prin

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer

# Load data

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])  # Remove Id from test set

)

)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target, 'Id'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', SimpleImputer(strategy='median'), numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

# Train on training data
X_train_encoded = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_encoded = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val_encoded)
val_r2 = r2_score(validation_df[target], y_val_pred)
print(f"Validation R2: {val_r2}")

# Predict on test set
X_test_encoded = preprocessor.transform(X_test)
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submissi

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target, 'Id'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', SimpleImputer(strategy='median'), numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create and train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

# Train on training data - fit on DataFrame directly
model.fit(X_train, train_df[target])

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val)
val_r2 = r2_score(validation_df[target], y_val_pred)
print(f"Validation R2: {val_r2}")

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
